meanings.definition: To grind or strike the teeth together in anger or pain.
meanings.sent1: She would gnash her teeth when she was upset.
meanings.sent2: The lion began to gnash its teeth as it felt threatened.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character would gnash his teeth whenever he was frustrated.
meanings.sent4: The gears of the old machine seemed to gnash together loudly.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the metal gnashing against metal echoed through the factory.

meanings.definition: A grinding or clenching of the teeth.
meanings.sent1: His constant gnash was a sign of his stress.
meanings.sent2: The dentist noticed the patient's gnash during the examination.
meanings.sent3: The sound of gnash could be heard from the quiet room.
meanings.sent4: The gnash of the gears in the clock tower could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent5: The gnash of the gears created a rhythmic beat in the workshop.
